SEARCH
Package gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class Kinematics

java.lang.Object
gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.Kinematics
public final class Kinematics extends Object

A library of functions to aid the computation of the kinematics of an aircraft. Kinematics refers to the movement of an aircraft, specifically, the velocity and acceleration components. These functions assume a Euclidean coordinate system (not in a spherical, geodesic frame); as such, most position inputs are as Vect3 or doubles. This assumption is particularly relevant to the ``turn'' related functions. In general, computations for ground speed and vertical speed results do not rely on a coordinate reference frame so they are valid in the Euclidean frame or in a geodesic frame; although, these functions still produce Vect3 outputs. All quantities are represented in internal units (SI units such as meters and seconds) where angles are represented in radians.

The functions are generally named according to the following pattern:
[basic operation][return value][goal parameter]
So, a method named gsAccelTime means the ground speed acceleration to compute a time.

  • [basic operation] can be one of turn, gsAccel, vsAccel, vsLevelOut, or accel. The operation accel means use calculations that are relevant for either ground speed or vertical speed. vsLevelOut means a maneuver involving a combined a pair of accelerations (for instance an acceleration and a deceleration).
  • [return value] the value produced by this method. This is optional, if it is left out, then position (distance), or position and velocity (speed) are returned.
  • [goal parameter] the goal that this method is trying to reach. This is optional, if it is left out, time is assumed. Most goals are indicated as phrases, ToRTA, ToDist, etc. Until is a special type of goal, meaning follow an acceleration until a speed target is reached, then follow a linear path.

  • Method Details

    • turnRadius

      public static double turnRadius(double speed, double bank, double g)
      Calculates turn radius from ground speed and bank angle.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed
      bank - bank angle (positive is clockwise looking out the nose of the aircraft), must be in (-pi/2,pi/2).
      g - local gravitational acceleration (must be positive)
      Returns:
      radius (always non-negative)

    • turnRadius

      public static double turnRadius(double speed, double bankAngle)
      Calculates turn radius from ground speed and bank angle. The function assumes standard sea-level gravity, see Units.gn.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed
      bankAngle - bank angle (positive is clockwise looking out the nose of the aircraft), must be in (-pi/2,pi/2).
      Returns:
      radius (always non-negative)

    • turnRadiusByRate

      public static double turnRadiusByRate(double speed, double omega)
      Calculates turn radius from ground speed and turn rate.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed
      omega - turn rate
      Returns:
      radius (always non-negative)

    • speedOfTurn

      public static double speedOfTurn(double R, double bank)
      Calculates ground speed of the vehicle from radius R and the bank angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
      Parameters:
      R - radius, must be non-negative
      bank - bank angle, must be in (-pi/2,pi/2)
      Returns:
      speed

    • turnRate

      public static double turnRate(double speed, double bankAngle)
      Calculates turn rate (or track-rate) from ground speed and bank angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed
      bankAngle - bank angle, must be in (-pi/2,pi/2)
      Returns:
      turn rate (ie. omega or track rate), positive turn rate is right hand turn.

    • turnRateByRadius

      public static double turnRateByRadius(double speed, double R)
      Calculates track rate (angular velocity) from ground speed and radius. Negative radius (or speed) will produce a negative result.

      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed (assumed to be positive)
      R - radius (assumed to be positive)
      Returns:
      turn rate (ie. omega or track rate). WARNING: this does not return the sign of the turn!!!!

    • turnRateGoal

      public static double turnRateGoal(Velocity vo, double goalTrack, double unsignedBank)
      Calculates turn rate (or track-rate) for the minimum turn to the goal track angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
      Parameters:
      vo - the initial velocity
      goalTrack - the goal track angle
      unsignedBank - the maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2)
      Returns:
      turn rate (ie. omega or track rate), positive turn rate is right hand turn.

    • bankAngle

      public static double bankAngle(double speed, double turnRate)
      Returns the calculated bank angle for a turn that has specified turnRate. Assumes sea-level gravity.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed (speed ≥ 0.0)
      turnRate - (positive is a right turn)
      Returns:
      bank angle (positive = turn right, negative = turn left)

    • bankAngleFromRadius

      public static double bankAngleFromRadius(double speed, double R)
      Calculates the bank angle used for a given turn radius and ground speed. This function does not have enough information to provide the sign of the bank angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed (speed ≥ 0.0)
      R - radius (R > 0.0)
      Returns:
      bank angle (positive)

    • bankAngleFromRadius

      public static double bankAngleFromRadius(double speed, double R, boolean turnRight)
      Calculates the bank angle used for a given turn radius and ground speed. Assumes sea-level gravity.
      Parameters:
      speed - ground speed (speed ≥ 0.0)
      R - radius (R > 0.0)
      turnRight - true, if a right turn is desired
      Returns:
      bank angle (positive = turn right, negative = turn left)

    • bankAngleGoal

      public static double bankAngleGoal(double track, double goalTrack, double unsignedBank)
      Find the minimum turn for the to reach the goal and returns the signed bank angle, with the correct sign to achieve that goal. Thus, this selects whether the smaller turn is a right turn or a left turn.
      Parameters:
      track - the current track
      goalTrack - the goal track angle
      unsignedBank - the maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2)
      Returns:
      bank angle (positive = turn right, negative = turn left)

    • turnTime

      public static double turnTime(Velocity v0, double goalTrack, double unsignedBank, int turnDir)
      Returns the time it takes to achieve the goal track angle
      Parameters:
      v0 - initial velocity vector
      goalTrack - target velocity track [rad]
      unsignedBank - maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2) [rad]
      turnDir - +1 = right, -1 = left
      Returns:
      time to achieve turn

    • turnTime

      public static double turnTime(Velocity v0, double goalTrack, double unsignedBank, boolean turnRight)
      Returns the time it takes to achieve the goal track angle
      Parameters:
      v0 - initial velocity vector
      goalTrack - target velocity track [rad]
      unsignedBank - maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2) [rad]
      turnRight - true iff only turn direction is to the right
      Returns:
      time to achieve turn

    • turnTime

      public static double turnTime(Velocity v0, double goalTrack, double unsignedBank)
      Returns the time it takes to achieve the goal track when making the minimum turn
      Parameters:
      v0 - initial velocity vector
      goalTrack - target velocity track [rad]
      unsignedBank - maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2) [rad]
      Returns:
      time to achieve turn

    • turnTime

      public static double turnTime(double groundSpeed, double deltaTrack, double bankAngle)
      Returns the time it takes to turn the given angle (deltaTrack). Depending on the signs of deltaTrack and bankAngle, this turn can be more than 180 degrees. If both deltaTrack and bankAngle are negative, they will cancel each other and this will result in a right turn.
      Parameters:
      groundSpeed - ground speed of aircraft
      deltaTrack - given angle of turn [rad], positive means right hand turn, negative means left
      bankAngle - bank angle (-pi/2,pi/2) [rad], positive means right hand turn, negative means left
      Returns:
      time to achieve turn

    • turnTime

      public static double turnTime(double deltaTrack, double omega)
      calculate turn time from delta track and turn rate (omega)
      Parameters:
      deltaTrack - track change over turn (sign ignored)
      omega - turn rate (sign ignored)
      Returns:
      turn time

      Linearly project the given position and velocity to a new position and velocity
      Parameters:
      sv0 - initial position and velocity
      t - time
      Returns:
      linear projection of sv0 to time t

    • linear

      public static Pair<Vect3,Velocity> linear(Vect3 s0, Velocity v0, double t)
      Linearly project the given position and velocity to a new position and velocity
      Parameters:
      s0 - initial position
      v0 - initial velocity
      t - time
      Returns:
      linear projection of sv0 to time t

    • centerOfTurn

      public static Vect2 centerOfTurn(Vect2 so, Vect2 vo, double R, int dir)

      Parameters:

      vo - velocity
      R - radius of turn
      dir - direction: 1 = right, -1 = left

    • turnTimeClosest

      public static double turnTimeClosest(Vect3 s0, Velocity v0, double omega, Vect3 x, double endTime)
      Calculate the time along the turn (formed by s0, v0, omega) that is closest to the given point.
      Parameters:
      s0 - turn start position
      v0 - turn start velocity
      omega - rate of turn (+ = right, - = left)
      x - point of interest
      endTime - time at which turn finishes. If less than or equal to 0, assume a full turn is allowed.
      Returns:
      time on turn when we are closest to the given point x (in seconds), or -1 if we are precisely at the turn's center This will be bounded by [0,endTime]

    • turnDistClosest

      public static double turnDistClosest(Vect3 s0, Velocity v0, double R, int dir, Vect3 x, double maxDist)
      Calculate the distance along the turn (formed by s0, v0, R, dir) that is closest to the given point.
      Parameters:
      s0 - turn start position
      v0 - turn start velocity
      R - turn radius
      dir - direction of turn
      x - point of interest
      maxDist - distance at which turn finishes. If less than or equal to 0, assume a full turn is allowed.
      Returns:
      distance on turn when we are closest to the given point x, or -1 if we are precisely at the turn's center This will be bounded by [0,maxDist]

    • turnTimeWithRoll

      public static Pair<Vect3,Velocity> turnTimeWithRoll(Vect3 so, Velocity vo, double t, double turnTime, double unsignedBank, int turnDir, double rollTime)
      EXPERIMENTAL Iterative kinematic turn with a roll rate, starting at bank angle of 0, up to a maximum bank angle.
      Parameters:
      so - initial position
      vo - initial velocity
      t - time point of interest
      turnTime - total time for this turn (sec) (cannot exceed time to perform 360 deg turn)
      unsignedBank - maximum allowable bank angle for this turn (rad)
      turnDir - +1 = turn right, -1 = turn left
      rollTime - time required for aircraft to roll to the unsignedBank angle
      Returns:
      return pair of new position, new velocity at end of turn

    • directTo

      public static Pair<Vect2,Vect2> directTo(Vect2 bot, Vect2 v0, Vect2 goal, double R)
      Given an initial position, initial velocity, and goal position (outside of the turn radius) calculate the end of turn and center of turn
      Parameters:
      bot - initial position (i.e. beginning of turn)
      v0 - initial velocity
      goal - goal position
      R - turn radius
      Returns:
      end of turn, center of turn. The end of turn will be INVALID if it cannot be reached from bot,v0 (due to being too close)

    • directToPoint

      public static Quad<Vect3,Velocity,Double,Integer> directToPoint(Vect3 so, Velocity vo, Vect3 wp, double R)
      Given an initial position and velocity, and a goal position (outside of the turn radius) calculate the end of turn and related information. Note that the turn can be greater than 180 degrees.
      Parameters:
      so - current position
      vo - current velocity
      wp - the intended goal way point
      R - turn radius
      Returns:
      (position of end of turn, velocity at end of turn, time to reach end of turn, direction of turn) If no result is possible (for example the point lies within the given turn radius), this will return a negative time.

    • testLoSTrk

      public static boolean testLoSTrk(Vect3 so, Velocity vo, Velocity nvo, Vect3 si, Velocity vi, double bankAngleOwn, boolean turnRightOwn, double stopTime, double D, double H)
      Test for LoS(so(t),si(t),D,H) between two aircraft when only ownship turns, compute trajectories up to time stopTime. Current implementation relies on a iterative calculation.
      Parameters:
      so - initial position of ownship
      vo - initial velocity of ownship
      nvo - the target velocity of ownship (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
      si - initial position of traffic
      vi - initial velocity of traffic
      bankAngleOwn - the bank angle of the ownship
      turnRightOwn - the turn direction of ownship
      stopTime - time duration to check for loss of separation
      D - horizontal distance to determine loss of separation
      H - vertical distance to determine loss of separation
      Returns:
      true is separation has been lost during the given time period

    • accelTime

      public static double accelTime(double speed0, double speedTarget, double accel)
      Returns time required to accelerate to target speed. This works for either ground speed or vertical speed. This version returns a 0.0 if accel is zero.
      Parameters:
      speed0 - current vertical speed
      speedTarget - vertical speed where the acceleration stops
      accel - vertical speed acceleration (sign is ignored)
      Returns:
      acceleration time

    • accel

      public static double accel(double speed0, double speedTarget, double accel)
      Distance traveled when accelerating (or decelerating) from speed to speedTarget. Note: this should return the same as accel(speed0, speedTarget, accel) = accelDistUntil(speed, speedTarget, accel, gsAccelTime(speed, speedTarget, accel).first);
      Parameters:
      speed0 - initial ground speed
      speedTarget - target ground speed
      accel - ground speed acceleration (sign ignored)
      Returns:
      distance needed to accelerate from speed to speedTarget with acceleration accel. This returns 0 if accel=0.

    • accelUntil

      public static Pair<Double,Double> accelUntil(double speed, double speedTarget, double accel, double dt)

      Parameters:
      speed - initial speed
      speedTarget - target speed
      accel - speed acceleration (sign ignored)
      dt - total time traveling
      Returns:
      (total distance traveled, speedFinal)

    • accelToDist

      public static Pair<Double,Double> accelToDist(double speed0, double dist, double accel)
      Accelerate for a given distance, then return the ending speed and time. Negative time indicates an error.
      Parameters:
      speed0 - ground speed in (must be positive)
      dist - distance
      accel - ground speed acceleration
      Returns:
      end ground speed and time. If the time is negative, then either the parameters were bad or we are declerating so fast that the distance will never be reached (the aircraft will go backwards before reaching dist).

      Parameters:
      gs - initial ground speed
      a_gs - signed ground speed acceleration
      dist - non-negative distance
      Returns:
      time required to cover distance, -1 if speed will reach zero before achieving the distance

    • accelSpeedToRTA

      public static Pair<Double,Double> accelSpeedToRTA(double gsIn, double dist, double rta, double gsAccel)
      Compute the goal speed needed to accelerate in order to reach a point at a given required time of arrival
      Parameters:
      gsIn - Current ground speed (m/s)
      dist - Current horizontal distance to goal point (m)
      rta - (relative) required time of arrival (s)
      gsAccel - maximum ground speed acceleration or deceleration (positive, m/s^2)
      Returns:
      (gs,time) the goal ground speed and acceleration time needed in order to cover the given distance in the given time. The time will be negative if the rta is not attainable.

      Parameters:
      gs1 - ground speed in
      gs3 - ground speed out
      d - total distance
      t - total time
      a1 - acceleration 1 (signed)

      Parameters:
      gs1 - starting speed
      gs2 - desired cruising speed
      gs3 - ending speed
      d - total distance
      t - relative time to RTA
      Returns:

    • gsAccelToRTAV

      public static Pair<Triple<Double,Double,Double>,Triple<Double,Double,Double>> gsAccelToRTAV(double gsIn, double dist, double rta, double gsOut, double gsAccel)
      This returns times and accelerations needed to reach an RTA at a given time with a given speed within a given distance.
      Parameters:
      gsIn - grounds speed in
      dist - distance to rta (relative)
      rta - time to rta (relative)
      gsOut - desired speed at rta
      gsAccel - acceleration (positive value)
      Returns:
      a pair of triples: ((t1,t2,t3),(a1,gs2,a2)) t1 is the time for an initial acceleration leg with constant acceleration a1, starting immediately t2 is the time to be spent traveling at gs2 t3 is the time for a final acceleration leg with constant acceleration a2, ending at the rta On failure, returns all negative values

    • vsLevelOutTimes

      public static Tuple5<Double,Double,Double,Double,Double> vsLevelOutTimes(double s0z, double v0z, double climbRate, double targetAlt, double accelup, double acceldown, boolean allowClimbRateChange)
      Returns key times for a two acceleration maneuver (aka a level out maneuver). This method properly models either climbs or descents. This method will properly choose the acceleration and deceleration for either climbs or descents (that is, for a descent, the accelDown is used first, and the accelUp is used for the second phase; for a climb the order of accelerations is reversed).
      Parameters:
      s0z - current vertical position
      v0z - current vertical speed
      climbRate - target climb rate between the accelerations
      targetAlt - target altitude
      accelup - positive acceleration
      acceldown - negative acceleration (deceleration)
      allowClimbRateChange - if true, if the current velocity is of greater magnitude than the specified climb rate, then continue at the current velocity (prioritize achieving the desired altitude). If false, first achieve the goal climb rate (prioritize achieving the indicated climbRate)
      Returns:
      <time of end of first accel, time of end of constant vertical speed phase, time of end of second accel phase, acceleration for phase 1, acceleration for phase 2 >

    • vsLevelOutTimes

      public static Tuple5<Double,Double,Double,Double,Double> vsLevelOutTimes(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> svo, double climbRate, double targetAlt, double accelup, double acceldown, boolean allowClimbRateChange)
      Returns key times for a two acceleration maneuver (aka a level out maneuver). This method properly models either climbs or descents. This method will properly choose the acceleration and deceleration for either climbs or descents (that is, for a descent, the accelDown is used first, and the accelUp is used for the second phase; for a climb the order of accelerations is reversed).
      Parameters:
      svo - current position and velocity
      climbRate - target climb rate between the accelerations
      targetAlt - target altitude
      accelup - positive acceleration
      acceldown - negative acceleration (deceleration)
      allowClimbRateChange - if true, if the current velocity is of greater magnitude than the specified climb rate, then continue at the current velocity (prioritize achieving the desired altitude). If false, first achieve the goal climb rate (prioritize achieving the indicated climbRate)
      Returns:
      <time of end of first accel, time of end of constant vertical speed phase, time of end of second accel phase, acceleration for phase 1, acceleration for phase 2 >. Note, the last two values will be either accelup or acceldown.

    • vsLevelOutTimes

      public static Tuple5<Double,Double,Double,Double,Double> vsLevelOutTimes(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> svo, double climbRate, double targetAlt, double a, boolean allowClimbRateChange)
      Returns key times for a two acceleration maneuver (aka a level out maneuver). This method properly models either climbs or descents. The deceleration value is assumed to be the negative of the positive acceleration value (parameter, a).
      Parameters:
      svo - current position and velocity
      climbRate - target climb rate between the accelerations
      targetAlt - target altitude
      a - positive acceleration
      allowClimbRateChange - if true, if the current velocity is of greater magnitude than the specified climb rate, then continue at the current velocity (prioritize achieving the desired altitude). If false, first achieve the goal climb rate (prioritize achieving the indicated climbRate)
      Returns:
      <time of end of first accel, time of end of constant vertical speed phase, time of end of second accel phase, acceleration for phase 1, acceleration for phase 2 >. Note, the last two values will be either a or -a.

    • timeNeededForFLC

      public static double timeNeededForFLC(double deltaZ, double vsFLC, double vsAccel, boolean kinematic)
      Time to achieve an altitude change of size deltaZ, assumes vertical speed is initially 0 and final vertical speed is also 0. Note: the initial and final vertical speeds are zero
      Parameters:
      deltaZ - change in altitude
      vsFLC - vertical speed of flight level change
      vsAccel - vertical acceleration
      kinematic - if true, include the extra time for acceleration and deceleration
      Returns:
      time

    • vsLevelOutTime

      public static double vsLevelOutTime(double deltaZ, double vsFLC, double vsAccel, boolean kinematic)

    • vsLevelOutTime

      public static double vsLevelOutTime(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> sv0, double climbRate, double targetAlt, double a, boolean allowClimbRateChange)
      Time to achieve the level out maneuver.
      Parameters:
      sv0 - current position and velocity vectors
      climbRate - climb rate
      targetAlt - target altitude
      a - positive acceleration
      allowClimbRateChange - allows climbRate to change to initial velocity if it can help.
      Returns:
      Time to achieve level out, or -1 if not achieved.

    • vsLevelOutClimbRate

      public static double vsLevelOutClimbRate(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> svo, double climbRate, double targetAlt, double accelup, double acceldown, boolean allowClimbRateChange)
      vertical speed achieved during the level out maneuver. Under many conditions, this equals the climbRate.
      Parameters:
      svo - current position and velocity vectors
      climbRate - climb rate
      targetAlt - target altitude
      accelup - first acceleration
      acceldown - second acceleration
      allowClimbRateChange - allows climbRate to change to initial velocity if it can help.
      Returns:
      vertical speed

    • vsLevelOutCalc

      public static Pair<Double,Double> vsLevelOutCalc(double soz, double voz, double targetAlt, double a1, double a2, double t1, double t2, double t3, double t)
      returns the vertical position and velocity at time t due to level out maneuver
      Parameters:
      soz - current vertical position
      voz - current vertical speed
      targetAlt - target altitude
      a1 - first acceleration
      a2 - second acceleration
      t1 - first time
      t2 - second time
      t3 - third time
      t - time point of interest
      Returns:
      position and velocity

    • testLoSVs

      public static boolean testLoSVs(Vect3 so, Velocity vo, Velocity nvo, Vect3 si, Velocity vi, double vsAccelOwn, double stopTime, double D, double H)
      Test for LoS(D,H) between two aircraft when only ownship accelerates (in vertical speed), compute trajectories up to time stopTime
      Parameters:
      so - initial position of ownship
      vo - initial velocity of ownship
      nvo - the target velocity of ownship (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
      si - initial position of traffic
      vi - initial velocity of traffic
      vsAccelOwn - ground speed acceleration of the ownship
      stopTime - the duration of the turns
      D - horizontal distance
      H - vertical distance
      Returns:
      minimum distance data packed in a Vect4

    • minDistTrk

      public static double minDistTrk(Vect3 so, Velocity vo, Velocity nvo, Vect3 si, Velocity vi, Velocity nvi, double bankAngOwn, double bankAngTraf, double stopTime)
      EXPERIMENTAL -- minimum distance between two aircraft when both turn, compute trajectories up to time stopTime
      Parameters:
      so - initial position of ownship
      vo - initial velocity of ownship
      nvo - the target velocity of ownship (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
      si - initial position of traffic
      vi - initial velocity of traffic
      nvi - the target velocity of traffic (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
      bankAngOwn - the bank angle of the ownship
      bankAngTraf - the bank angle of the traffic
      stopTime - the duration of the turns
      Returns:
      the minimum distance

    • minDistBetweenTrk

      public static Vect4 minDistBetweenTrk(Vect3 so, Velocity vo, Velocity nvo, Vect3 si, Velocity vi, Velocity nvi, double bankAngOwn)
      Minimum distance between two aircraft when BOTH turn, compute trajectories up to time stopTime
      Parameters:
      so - initial position of ownship
      vo - initial velocity of ownship
      nvo - the target velocity of ownship (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
      si - initial position of traffic
      vi - initial velocity of traffic
      nvi - the target velocity of traffic (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
      bankAngOwn - the bank angle of the ownship
      Returns:
      minDistH,minDist,minDistV,minT
